headline: By Grace of the Internet, We’re All Storefronts Now
abstract: Our columnist surveys his lovingly curated closet and finds that there is also joy in letting go.
lead_paragraph: Around 10 years ago to the day, I wrote my first column as the Critical Shopper. In that time, I’ve written about more than 150 stores, spanning luxury outposts and discount retailers, malls and pocket-size shops, decades-old spots and places that quickly vanished. But I’ve never written about the one I’m most familiar with.
